text: so i was in china obviously
and uh i wanted to learn the language
and i don't know if you've ever tried to
learn mandarin but it's very hard
devilishly tricky very sinuous very
exotic very other the sounds required to
speak mandarin are so unlike anything in
our language
wonderful sounds we make only at moments
of revulsion or disgusting
it's often handy to have a carton of off
milk with you when learning mandarin
nice pronunciation thank you
and the other problem of course is the
tones the intonation you know if you get
that wrong that could radically alter
the meaning of the word
i'll give an example the word ma in
mandarin in the different tones
that means mother hemp horse or
disappointment
that is a social disaster waiting to
happen right there
yeah since your horse died i've been
smoking a lot of your mother
and i just wanted a bit of conversation
you know a bit of chit chat i wanted to
order some food off a street seller in
beijing
so i learned the word for dumpling which
is
dalton that's the lovely quality of
mandarin it's got a sound of like i know
what i'm talking about no it don't
and i learned the word hello which isn't
he how so to help me pronounce it i sort
of physicalized the words as i went up
to i said

she looked terrified out of a witch
because i presumably said i want a
laminator cat
and if you think speaking it's hard the
written chinese is an enigma wrapped in
a puzzle cloaked
in a mystery because chinese characters
of which there are many
thousands contain all these elaborate
pictograms and store stories and sub
stories
the pictogram meaning i'm thirsty when
you literally translate it it means i
wasn't thirsty before
but now i am thirsty
so each one can change an elaborate
backstory to the thing that you actually
want
like uh painkiller is i didn't really
like david bowie's later work i wouldn't
mind some neurofin
or i threw a stone into the pond the
ripples bounced off the bank they met in
the middle in a beautiful helix a
waterfall and i shared a moment anyway
all that being the case would you mind
calling me an ambulance
while we were there we went to a chinese
restaurant because it was loads of them
and in the window there were the
familiar sights crabs prawns bubbling
away in tanks but there amongst this
familiar stuff was more exotic fare
a salamander in a bath civic cats in
cages
snakes slithering on the floor and there
was a cormorant
looking doubly pissed off and
amongst these things on the menu in the
front of the restaurant was an
hour and not just an ordinary owl a
eurasian eagle owl an enormous
magnificent beast just waiting to be on
the buffet
and i'm thinking if this is the stuff
they got out the front what have they
got out of the back special
order a bigfoot a push me bully
a lorax
a phoenix mind you that'd be tricky to

you'd have to trick it poach it or

so we tried to buy the owl i thought i
can't leave this owl here you know i
mean i was something there was something
inside me you know i had to
had to do the right thing you know
because the goose didn't make it yeah
so yeah it was always weighing on my
heart so if we can get this owl out of
here that'll be a good thing a private
ryan moment so there's a bit of haggling
and and some almost some disastrous
haggling because of course you know the
only word you know is dumpling then
trying to buy an owl in a restaurant and
not get it cooked into a dumpling is
quite hard
but eventually they agreed and it was
all smiles then it was like these crazy
westerners want to take away owl
so they wrapped it in cellotape from
beak to claw
now that's quite undignified for an hour
and i'm not an expert but i don't think
that's the correct way of moving owls
around
this hour was so angry i mean it was
i've never seen a creature so pissed off
it was like
it was like a bloke that just got a
paper cut off his eviction notice you
know what i mean it was like
we put it in a cardboard box marked
suitable for microwave oven
the ultimate in dignity and then we put
it in a taxi and drove off
and through the medium of pointing we
told the taxi driver to take us to the
woods
take us up to the woods where we can
release the owl and so we got to the
woods it was
getting dark it was the dusk and by the
light of the taxi we tried to get the
owl
out of the box it was a bit of a
struggle it was pretty brutal i'm
thrashing around with it and the owl's
fixing me with this glare like
is this what you do in your holidays
beardy
stella tape up owls and drive them
around in the woods
what are you doing next year gaffering
up a gazelle chuckling down a water

and while i was thrashing with it i'm
thinking this is the point i look up and
see the headmaster of my son's school on
a cycling holiday of southern china
oh and oh mr bailey oh
it's not what it looks like uh it's
bilady's birthday party
uh we're playing passer parcel or
something
and i was looking around for something
to cut the cello tape off we had nothing
we looked in the boot of the taxi he had
an oven glove
in his boot and some nail scissors in
his glove box i'm thinking is this just
a scam is this an
owl homing scam we've just blundered
into it no i can't think like that
so i said to him although he didn't
speak a word of english i said
you hold the owl's talons with the oven
gloves
and i'll cut the cellotape off the owl
with the nail scissors
now there's not a phrasebook in the
